description: Explore our solar system, planets, moons, and small bodies

slides.title: Welcome to Planetary Science
slides.content:
# Introduction to Planetary Science

Welcome to **Planetary Science** - exploring our cosmic neighborhood!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Solar System Formation** - How it all began
- **Terrestrial Planets** - Rocky worlds
- **Giant Planets** - Gas and ice giants
- **Moons** - Diverse satellites
- **Small Bodies** - Asteroids, comets, dwarf planets

> **Fun Fact:** Saturn's moon Titan has lakes of liquid methane!

slides.title: Solar System Formation
slides.content:
# Solar System Formation

## Nebular Hypothesis:
1. Molecular cloud collapses
2. Rotating disk forms
3. Center becomes Sun
4. Dust accumulates into planetesimals
5. Planetesimals grow into planets

## Timeline:
- 4.6 billion years ago
- Heavy bombardment period
- Late planetary migration

## Frost Line:
- Inside: Rocky planets (too hot for ice)
- Outside: Icy bodies, gas giants
- At ~5 AU in our system

slides.title: Mercury
slides.content:
# Mercury

## Quick Facts:
- Smallest planet
- Closest to Sun (0.39 AU)
- No atmosphere (very thin exosphere)
- Huge temperature swings (-180 to 430 C)

## Properties:
| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Diameter | 4,879 km |
| Mass | 0.055 Earth |
| Day | 59 Earth days |
| Year | 88 Earth days |

## Features:
- Heavily cratered
- Large iron core (75% of radius)
- Ice in polar craters
- 3:2 spin-orbit resonance

slides.title: Planets Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which planet is closest to the Sun?

slides.title: Venus
slides.content:
# Venus

## Quick Facts:
- Earth's "twin" in size
- Thick CO2 atmosphere
- Extreme greenhouse effect
- Retrograde rotation

## Properties:
| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Diameter | 12,104 km |
| Mass | 0.82 Earth |
| Day | 243 Earth days |
| Year | 225 Earth days |
| Surface temp | 465 C |

## Atmosphere:
- 96% CO2
- Sulfuric acid clouds
- 90 bar surface pressure
- Cloud tops reflect 70% of sunlight

slides.title: Earth
slides.content:
# Earth

## Unique Features:
- Liquid water on surface
- Active plate tectonics
- Oxygen-rich atmosphere
- Diverse biosphere

## Properties:
| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Diameter | 12,742 km |
| Mass | 5.97 x 10^24 kg |
| Distance | 1 AU |
| Year | 365.25 days |

## Layers:
- Crust (5-70 km)
- Mantle (2,900 km)
- Outer core (liquid iron)
- Inner core (solid iron)

## Moon:
- 3,474 km diameter
- Formed by giant impact

slides.title: Mars
slides.content:
# Mars

## The Red Planet:
- Iron oxide surface (rust)
- Thin CO2 atmosphere
- Polar ice caps
- Large volcanoes and canyon

## Properties:
| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Diameter | 6,779 km |
| Mass | 0.11 Earth |
| Day | 24.6 hours |
| Year | 687 Earth days |

## Features:
- Olympus Mons: Largest volcano (21 km)
- Valles Marineris: 4,000 km canyon
- Evidence of ancient water
- Two small moons: Phobos, Deimos

slides.title: Jupiter
slides.content:
# Jupiter

## The Giant:
- Largest planet
- More mass than all others combined
- No solid surface

## Properties:
| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Diameter | 139,820 km |
| Mass | 318 Earth |
| Day | 9.9 hours |
| Year | 11.9 Earth years |

## Features:
- Great Red Spot (storm)
- Powerful magnetic field
- At least 95 moons
- Faint ring system

## Key Moons:
- Io: Volcanic
- Europa: Subsurface ocean
- Ganymede: Largest moon
- Callisto: Heavily cratered

slides.title: Saturn
slides.content:
# Saturn

## The Ringed Planet:
- Spectacular ring system
- Less dense than water
- Hexagonal polar storm

## Properties:
| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Diameter | 116,460 km |
| Mass | 95 Earth |
| Day | 10.7 hours |
| Year | 29.5 Earth years |

## Rings:
- Made of ice and rock
- Very thin (10 m to 1 km)
- Maybe 100 million years old

## Key Moons:
- Titan: Thick atmosphere, methane lakes
- Enceladus: Ice geysers, ocean
- 146+ known moons

slides.title: Uranus and Neptune
slides.content:
# Ice Giants

## Uranus:
| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Diameter | 50,724 km |
| Mass | 14.5 Earth |
| Tilt | 98 degrees! |
| Year | 84 Earth years |
- Rolls on its side
- Faint rings, 27 moons
- Methane = blue-green color

## Neptune:
| Property | Value |
|----------|-------|
| Diameter | 49,244 km |
| Mass | 17 Earth |
| Distance | 30 AU |
| Year | 165 Earth years |
- Strongest winds in solar system
- Triton: Large retrograde moon
- 16 known moons

slides.title: Dwarf Planets
slides.content:
# Dwarf Planets

## Definition:
- Orbits Sun
- Enough mass for spherical shape
- Has NOT cleared its orbit

## Known Dwarf Planets:

| Name | Location | Size |
|------|----------|------|
| Ceres | Asteroid belt | 946 km |
| Pluto | Kuiper belt | 2,377 km |
| Eris | Scattered disk | 2,326 km |
| Makemake | Kuiper belt | 1,430 km |
| Haumea | Kuiper belt | 1,632 km |

## Pluto:
- Discovered 1930
- Reclassified 2006
- 5 moons (Charon largest)
- New Horizons flyby 2015

slides.title: Asteroids and Comets
slides.content:
# Small Bodies

## Asteroids:
- Rocky/metallic
- Mostly in asteroid belt (Mars-Jupiter)
- Largest: Ceres (now dwarf planet)
- Near-Earth objects: Potential hazards

## Comets:
- Ice + dust ("dirty snowballs")
- Long periods: Oort cloud origin
- Short periods: Kuiper belt origin
- Develop tail near Sun

## Kuiper Belt:
- Beyond Neptune (30-50 AU)
- Source of short-period comets
- Contains dwarf planets

## Oort Cloud:
- Spherical shell of icy bodies
- 2,000-100,000 AU
- Source of long-period comets

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Planetary Science Summary

## Terrestrial Planets:
- Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars
- Rocky, dense, small

## Giant Planets:
- Jupiter, Saturn: Gas giants
- Uranus, Neptune: Ice giants

## Notable Moons:
| Moon | Feature |
|------|--------|
| Titan | Methane atmosphere |
| Europa | Subsurface ocean |
| Io | Active volcanoes |

## Small Bodies:
- Asteroids: Rocky
- Comets: Icy, develop tails
- Dwarf planets: Pluto, Ceres, Eris

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Planetary Science!
